articles.title: about me
articles.contents:
As a child, I used to sit with my head out of the window on long road trips, scribbling the mountain tops with my fingertips. It was cathartic for my young mind, contemplating what I had learned during my environmental education lessons at camp in Rocky Mountain National Park. Between crafting water filtration devices out of rocks or painting using leaves, I learned to love the natural environment through direct connections with others and the world around me. These creative and welcoming experiences in outdoor education led to me studying environmental engineering.
My interest in corporate environmental management began after I was selected to join Marquette University’s newly formed sustainability committee to strategize long-term climate goals in 2016. While collaborating alongside the university’s leaders and peers who shared my passion, I realized that no singular institution, no matter how progressive, how passionate, or how well-funded, could solve the climate crisis alone. Transforming our current system will require partnership across organizations. Change not only requires but also demands collaboration and innovation which are strengthened by an analytical mindset and a scientific approach. I began to understand corporate influence and industry-wide collaboration during my contract role on Patagonia’s Social and Environmental Responsibility team. At Patagonia, I developed the strategy and methodology surrounding 2025 zero-waste goals. I also supported Patagonia’s carbon neutrality and renewable energy goals by serving as the focal point for metric and inventory aggregation, researching industry best practices, and streamlining carbon accounting methodology. Lastly, I helped manage Patagonia’s Higg Brand & Retailer Module self-assessment, Green-e® certification, and Science-Based Target Initiative development.
I have also gained experience in energy efficiency, benchmarking, and data analysis in my consulting roles. While in a consulting role in Colorado, I received the honor to attend and present at the Sustainable Denver Summit where I spoke about the success of the Energize Denver program. Within one year of reporting for buildings greater than 50,000 square feet, the city reduced its energy consumption by 4.5%, totaling $13.5 million in energy cost savings. While managing this required program, I engaged and educated program members through supporting both web-based and in-person trainings, wrote up website content, and created data visualizations. While at Partner Energy in Los Angeles, I managed client’s energy and water benchmarking, utility data collection, and analysis for energy performance programs such as Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Green loans, HUD Annual Benchmarking, and ENERGY STAR Certification. At the Bren School, I am specializing in corporate environmental management with a focus in Strategic Environmental Communication and Media. My goal is to create regenerative systems in a corporate environment that could design waste and pollution out of systems altogether in the apparel industry. I also will focus on environmental justice issues as it relates to the apparel industry.
As much as I enjoy my career in sustainability, I enjoy some pretty cool hobbies as well. I like to ski, snowboard, climb, hike, bike, and as of recently, SCUBA diving. I want to be outside as much as possible. I also believe no act of kindness is ever wasted, and try to carry this above anything else. So go get outside if you can!

Bio
Taylor is a corporate sustainability professional with experience in project management focused on greenhouse gas accounting, energy efficiency, and waste reduction. Through her experience at Patagonia and in the consulting world, she has developed a strong background in data management, visualization, and analytics as it relates to climate goals. On top of having a technical environmental engineering background, she is also skilled at building relationships across an organization to catalyze climate goals. Taylor received her B.S. Environmental Engineering from Marquette University. Taylor is pursuing a master’s at the UCSB Bren School, where she is specializing in corporate environmental management with a focus in Strategic Environmental Communication and Media.
Education
Bren School of Environmental Science & Management – The University of California, Santa Barbara | Santa Barbara, CA
M.S. of Environmental Science and Management | September 2021 - May 2023
Marquette University | Milwaukee, WI
B.S. in Environmental and Civil Engineering | September 2013 - June 2017
Experience
Senior Sustainability Coordinator – Partner Energy, Los Angeles, CA (10/20–7/21)
-Managed the Quality Control (QC) of 200+ Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Green loan energy reports which led to additional financing for green building improvements
-Executed the data collection, analysis, and validation of energy and water data for a portfolio for 30+ multifamily buildings and 6,485 units spanning six states; incorporated analysis for continued monitoring of 30% reduction of energy and water consumption for green loan requirements
-Completed 5+ ENERGY STAR® building certification projects to quantify client’s green improvements
Environmental Responsibility Consultant – Patagonia, Ventura, CA (12/19–5/20)
-Remodeled Patagonia’s internal environmental metrics analytics platform for data spanning 15+ countries for automated Scope 1 and 2 emissions evaluations which contributed to Patagonia’s 2020 Renewable Energy Goal and 2025 Carbon Neutrality Goal
-Developed an in-depth energy analysis of Patagonia’s international footprint to analyze gaps in data collection and streamline future carbon accounting processes
-Mobilized an internal team of five to create Patagonia’s 2025 zero waste strategy, developed comprehensive waste measurement and audit methodology, rollout timeline, and staff resources
-Managed Patagonia’s Higg Brand & Retailer Module self-assessment, Green-e® certification, and Science Based Target Initiative development to ensure brand certifications met critical deadlines
Sustainability Consultant – Overlay Consulting, Denver, CO (4/18–12/19)
-Managed the Energize Denver Benchmarking program which resulted in an energy reduction of 4.5 percent from 2016 to 2017, totaling $13.5 million in energy cost savings
-Designed automated building energy tracking through individualized Salesforce platforms for five U.S. cities totaling 6,208 buildings and 525,580,154 square feet for government-mandated energy programs
-Oversaw Denver and Boulder’s Help Center, supported both web-based and in-person trainings, and completed routine weekly data quality checks to ensure accurate compliance percentages
-Authored an eight-page article for the Colorado Real Estate Journal on the Energize Denver program success and presented my findings at the 2018 Sustainable Denver Summit for an audience of 50 people
Additional Experiences
Environmental Studies Teaching Assistant – UC Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara, CA (9/21 - Current)
-Spring 2022: Environmental Chemistry II
-Winter 2022: Environmental Chemistry I
-Fall 2021: Building Sustainable Communities: From Environmental Injustice to Just Sustainability and Regeneration
Consultant – Seed Consulting, Orange County, CA (8/20-11/20)
Environmental Field Technician – Urban GIS, Chicago, IL (2/18 – 3/18)
Research and Development Intern – Pentair, Milwaukee, WI (5/16-8/16)
Skills
Computer: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint), R-Studio, Salesforce, CR360, Engie Impact
Project and Data Management Tools: Tableau Prep and Desktop, Trello, Microsoft Teams
